title: Grade 1
subject: English Language Arts - Extended Learning Standards (2019-)

document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended with Learning Progressions English Language Arts

FAE8525788D74E5A9DD9667CBCB3CEB2.description: Actively engage during oral language experiences.

73099EB068B442D4A9B6F3C294320C1C.description: Actively participate during activities by interjecting words or phrases that include a conjunction.

655676AA4B5945F7AA3404476BD4F2BC.description: Select words and phrases from oral language experiences that include conjunctions.

E13785775F154E8CBE1CF2A8C1F5FA48.description: Use parts of speech to create simple sentences

8CB39B899FF148F6AC2E83B3C7018ECB.description: Analyze words used in oral language experiences as having a part of speech

EE6F381F619A429CA1000671A9225A70.description: Listen to the words and phrases used by peers, adults and in texts

5564A0F55C6542ABA97E5117D4EED3A4.description: Listen to language then describe meaning

FE890FEF815E4DD88EB1EECF26805596.description: Chorally respond by saying repeat lines in text

850584AA6F1A4D00AF760B788B9BC809.description: Select words and phrases that apply to everyday events

99384325726F4E7DB790D72FA7BD6E65.description: Identify conjunctions as word that connects (sentences) or expands ideas (clauses).

D62D7D44FE3546829E00DEFECF90B8FC.description:
Use words and
phrases acquired through
conversations, reading
and being read to, and
responding to texts, including
using frequently occurring
conjunctions to signal simple
relationships (e.g., because).

9179847691C94A2393900D0883D0F516.description: Actively engage in word development activities.

A12429C87FB34E9BAC26A049947BEE7A.description: Combine words into phrases, sentences, paragraphs and books to tell more and more about a topic

74215EAABAC345C79229847763448690.description: Identify that every word has meaning

8F1AF8CBFC2B4B93ACBF1DD34535ACF3.description: Use words to help others understand ideas, thoughts, feelings, etc.

6AB1411AB94F42F0AF5F783307D6A8CB.description: Select words help us understand what others are trying to tell us

96D516EF025347C1B89ADA301BB83B80.description: Use words can be used to describe everyday people and places

C02A834AE8F74F7E944C216418E3D02C.description: Identify that adjectives, verbs and nouns can be used to describe other words - attributes

ED48911D64884FCD96B69E096F72078B.description: Select words from categories that can be used to write on specific topics

A7A3F3359B6D469683B2B9A8A68E7BF7.description: Select word choice to add detail and intensity to what we speak and write

9B5FF19D31D3448FA8FA4BCCC32FEA29.description: learn that more than one word can be used to convey similar meaning

B0793E78D7264A9CBC5D294ACF940CFF.description: Sort objects paired with words into categories representing meaning (themes, everyday groupings, experiences, settings, etc.)

0076DA874FFA4244992D4DFB803EE889.description: Describe attributes of familiar or newly learned words to develop meaning.

D92B29A68ACE4B5E8F81787A72FF710F.description:
With modeling and scaffolding order three or more words from least intense to most intense to show shades of meaning. (e.g.
big, bigger, biggest)

3610B2DEEB4D46CB80A73CA3202067AB.description:
With guidance
and support from adults,
demonstrate understanding
of word relationships and
nuances in word meanings.
a. Sort words into categories
(e.g., colors, clothing)
to gain a sense of the
concepts the categories
represent.
b. Define words by category
and by one or more key
attributes (e.g., a duck is a
bird that swims; a tiger is a
large cat with stripes).
c. Identify real-life connections
between words and their
use (e.g., note places at
home that are cozy).
d. Distinguish shades of
meaning among verbs
differing in manner (e.g.,
look, peek, glance, stare,
glare, scowl) and adjectives
differing in intensity (e.g.,
large, gigantic) by defining
or choosing them or by
acting out the meanings.

E79FB193DADE4416A1D64A37CC1D5A37.description: Actively engage in word meaning activities.

79D2F1DB40FD473AA4C8DE0E2F540756.description: Pair words with meaning and concrete examples from everyday life

8C0CBC5E13FE4286912FE3811D2D21DC.description: Identify a root word as a whole word inside a larger word

87D0CC07ABB448E9A4D1CD31F39919C8.description: Identify that there are different types of words (compound, past tense, plural, contractions, etc.)

B2B8432606C44353AD71792A9EE95862.description: Identify that many word parts have meaning

AF91114B040E40D3A443F7A33B7F311E.description: With modeling and support break words into syllables visually

FE663E045C654125AC65B57CE1FE55E0.description: With modeling and support break words into syllables orally

309CDD3C610F412A93CC1BE0915A7234.description: Actively participate in word meaning (vocabulary syntax and semantics) activities.

92D7A48917BE490AA7F1BD27888151CE.description: L.K2.3c Identify familiar objects or pictures that represent new 1st grade words.

040A4186EE104EBD843E16922EC0C48D.description: Identify a root word as a whole word inside a larger word.

91935EE223584E39A259A220AD01A61F.description:
Identify the new meaning of a word when a root word is paired with a prefix or suffix. (e.g. dog + s = more than one dog OR re
+ tie = tie again)

77DA10C716CB4B39940BF923578C9517.description:
Determine or clarify
the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 1
reading and content, choosing
flexibly from an array of
strategies.
a. Use sentence-level context
as a clue to the meaning of
a word or phrase.
b. Use frequently occurring
affixes as a clue to the
meaning of a word.
c. Identify frequently occurring
root words (e.g., look) and
their inflectional forms (e.g.,
looks, looked, looking).

3BF07C396FB04307BEE611E34B931BE1.description: Actively engage during phonological awareness and phonics activities.

F42B33DAF20F48D39992516D1B0F547A.description: match letter sounds in simple words to letter tiles or letter shapes

F6AD4177656D437C823B43857EF9CB62.description: match sounds in simple words to placeholders for letters (Elkonin boxes with chips)

02621553D1ED4BC88323A65424BB3FF5.description: say or identify each of the consonant sounds (most commonly used)

087E9A5545684D3FA3E1CF880F0D4B72.description: say or identify each of the short vowel sounds

F1FF4E0EA5FC494EA97D852FD990FA3F.description: identify letters as sounds in speech and writing

7852A9EA934C439D895714E6FADC527F.description: identify one or more reasons we capitalize words

6F9682731D8C41B09B7546853309D096.description: match punctuation mark with sentence type

CD7AA6A324EC43B5B087405118E74EB4.description: identify a sentence as beginning with a capital letter and ending with punctuation

BA4AE51C726F45759D7073A417AC26BC.description: Order and manipulate the sounds in simple words.

16C2186AFDD947AB88B9668BBC19CF56.description: Match letter sounds to letters in print.

33F7E2035EC34037A550EC05C5AFFAE6.description: Write letters representing sounds in simple words.

F08F19B8BC624D47919741934003D5AC.description:
Demonstrate command
of the conventions of standard
English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling
when writing.
a. Capitalize dates and names
of people.
b. Use end punctuation for
sentences.
c. Use commas in dates and
to separate single words in
a series.
d. Use conventional spelling
for words with common
spelling patterns and
for frequently occurring
irregular words.
e. Spell untaught words
phonetically, drawing on
phonemic awareness and
spelling conventions.

0911C363FF0541F3AED9C5871A2FBB8D.description: Communicate during writing or speaking using two or more word combinations during a shared writing or speaking activity

408B2D1CAFD64EBCA696CD5D42A11F3E.description:
Demonstrate command
of the conventions of standard
a. English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.
b. Print all upper-and lowercase
letters.
c. Use common, proper, and
possessive nouns.
d. Use singular and plural nouns
with matching verbs in basic
sentences (e.g., He hops; We
hop).
e. Use personal, possessive, and
indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me,
my; they, them, their; anyone,
everything).
f. Use verbs to convey a sense of
past, present, and future (e.g.,
Yesterday, I walked home;
Today, I walk home; Tomorrow,
I will walk home).
g. Use frequently occurring
adjectives.
h. Use frequently occurring
coordinating and subordinating
conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or,
so, because).
i. Use determiners (e.g., articles,
demonstratives).
j. Use frequently occurring
prepositions (e.g., during,
beyond, toward).
k. Produce and expand complete
simple and compound
declarative, interrogative,
imperative, and exclamatory
sentences in response to
prompts.

4DB0D66002B84840B1DFADFF5E01A355.description: Communicate using one picture or word.

855FDFADF910402E81D1C1AC88837ECD.description: Communicate using simple sentence containing a subject and verb.

9EF84999EBE64CB78286790B72863F97.description: Communicate appropriately to task or situation. (on topic, in response to question or prompt)

54B9459990BC4FBC9D7EAC7DFF903000.description:
Produce complete
sentences when appropriate
to task and situation.

F4BCA37DFAC24EA7A372731AAF69D3E5.description: Engage with pictures that can be used to communicate.

CC496D50B9AE4251AB9E98D4CE4093B9.description: Use pictures to communicate feelings, needs, thoughts or ideas.

9B24782D22374C19A2A33D8B4064EEF9.description: Select one or more picture(s) that represents a story or experience.

6568F4D86AA8476E93A4D2660009C6C9.description: Select or draw details in pictures to add meaning to a story or experience

4D210AEB9A164038B1CD9FCC3894695A.description: Pair visuals with text to clarify ideas and make meaning.

72E7697F52C0435D9E71259AF195418B.description:
Add drawings or other
visual displays to descriptions
when appropriate to clarify
ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

E176C4C62A8F4AEE964174224ADDA6C1.description: Actively participate in events with familiar people, places, things.

1032B56E1C114F7CB141CBC66F7D3D13.description: Actively engage with familiar people in familiar places, with familiar things and/or during familiar events.

DBB81F483CC9463B8A62A87D757FED1A.description: Actively participate in selection of familiar people, things, events places with which to interact.

6ED245217EE04591BCEF1D0F59D40227.description: participate in autobiography (All About Me) activities

33C5B9860D74426889F37F5038D18956.description: share about familiar things during show and tell

DD3C24C6D70141EF88DD744493123E47.description: share personal experiences in a journal or share time

E1F33495E90141EB9A1B6EE63586A41E.description:
create a circles graph referencing people who are personal friends or family members and others who are acquaintances or
strangers

BC71A65E82D34262812BEEEFA4CFD7F4.description: participate in interest inventories/surveys about preferences

7B093C1F118C468FB3B91D9137384139.description: Select a familiar topic (person place, thing, or event) for discussion.

06C1580AC91C4DB289857D39289D0EDE.description: Express feelings about a familiar topic (person, place, thing, or event).

08C400DE16D74AF7B7D7045ABB345300.description: Describe a person, place, thing, or event from a personal experience.

ACAFA6BB3FB34142A37D35582344E7A8.description:
Describe people,
places, things, and events
with relevant details,
expressing ideas and feelings
clearly.

BF299EFBF72748F8BE25BF4E1E41C321.description: Actively engage with others to get attention when in need.

90FA6E9BB6284AB8BD62EF5FB18B9DC9.description: Seek opportunities for purposeful interactions with others.

03DA07DF17D4450DB45822EE7D49FAF4.description: Establish a mode of communication that flexibly includes age-appropriate topics and skills

03D34A843CEA425BB1CB02435C78A4ED.description: Establish a mode of communication that is understood by others

8ACCF65D60044F1CA8F94FC54000CB74.description:
Recall one detail shared by the speaker following a general question. (e.g. What was your favorite detail speaker shared?
What do you remember? What was this presentation about? etc.)

8C341D5F21264ABB8672F6E94802E90D.description: Ask a question inquire further about the speaker’s topic.

27BE02F7A606468283DCA9FC014D25AB.description:
Ask and answer
questions about what a
speaker says in order to
gather additional information
or clarify something that is not
understood.

907F6756D28E4A569A5981B7DAE12E4A.description: Actively participate in text read aloud, in various formats, by actively engaging and/or commenting.

6E20FCECE1594851B636095386F191FA.description: Indicate interest or inquiry about text vocabulary, pictures, minor details, topic, author, etc.

7FE348EBB7864B4AA552E6C7B545FCEB.description: Answer a question related to the text read-aloud.

697C70D3DE0F44A49D32307D3A72D243.description: Ask a question related to the text read-aloud by providing key details from the text or other media.

BD6F951F9C02443C92DB22607B4DD2D9.description:
Ask and answer
questions about key details
in a text read aloud or
information presented in
various media and other
formats (e.g., orally).

EB25D4F450F543D0B50D3086802BC7C8.description: Use any mode of communication to participate in a collaborative conversation.

C25A48917D0448EF85240EE43FC0B11D.description: Actively participate in conversation about 1st grade appropriate topics or text.

8E5C2AA85ABA49D1BF7EE9D7676984D7.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

3E117272653D45469A80BD27113E2625.description: Follow agreed upon rules (e.g., gaining attention, listening to others, turn-taking

E86B6FD9D37B42C6967AAEF2B96910E4.description: Actively participate in supported conversations about 1st grade appropriate topics and text.

9D004175299A41728854EC692CD900D5.description: Follow agreed upon rules (e.g., gaining attention, listening to others, turn-taking.

3617AA98781342BAB95376CBC3D2D743.description: Participate in group discussions about 1st grade appropriate topics and text.

D52AEA90FE2B42ABA62D4B12CE67F3BD.description:
Participate in
collaborative conversations
with diverse partners about
grade 1 topics and texts with
peers and adults in small and
larger groups.
a. Follow agreed-upon rules
for discussions (e.g.,
listening to others with care,
speaking one at a time
about the topics and texts
under discussion).
b. Build on others’ talk
in conversations by
responding to the
comments of others through
multiple exchanges.
c. Ask questions to clear up
any confusion about the
topics and texts under
discussion.

9E3080A744984B918F5EB386683C66AF.description: Recall information from a daily experience by reviewing pictures taken of the event.

AD06E0F96D744E1F9DC384836A147C4A.description: Order pictures from an experience to demonstrate recall of information.

84604736CB2943DB9BBE9A0FCDC50E5C.description: Demonstrate knowledge that a question mark is a printed indicator of a question.

EBDA27D05E894F50A7C9AD35DA8D6A1B.description:
With scaffolding and support, respond with an answer (using any mode of communication) when a question mark is seen in
print.

2518D74036C9468B98827475158B38FA.description: Select a detail from experiences or research to answer a question.

3CF2BA9200954D94B430EBF1408B488C.description:
With guidance and
support from adults, recall
information from experiences
or gather information from
provided sources to answer a
question.

73436952FA164F16A2F0191A30405F89.description: Engage with peer during a shared research or writing project.

15C7A1E1E25A40049CD81958C0F1BC60.description: Engage with “how-to” books on a topic of choice.

3E36DB6B945547EDAAC5840FA31826DA.description: Identify a “how-to” book from an array of informational text.

E655E772A5E04095A7E863BC2BAFA207.description: Select/share a topic of interest for research.

75E3548C20434503BF1B1D622229EDB1.description: Identify directions or how-to sequence of instructions, or other notable research information in a text.

F0DD19B3BEDB4F89ABB546818E6DDAB4.description:
Recall information from research, using notes, outline task analysis, picture sequence, etc., to use in another application. (e.g.
construction project, cooking experience, plan a trip, develop a report, sequence of events, etc.)

DF61BA6438434205A0DE5627E31D0B1A.description: Collaborate to take notes on a shared topic.

F8EACE2E896148A680D930A40B71D521.description: Develop shared writing with a peer.

D831EE0198334F5D8A47C54756C7D1B7.description:
Participate in shared
research and writing projects
(e.g., explore a number of
“how-to” books on a given
topic and use them to write a
sequence of instructions)..

DF49088DB04A42E39AC3622FA5EEE629.description:
Research to Build and
Present Knowledge

93D5D63513854903800FACBD199B2FEE.description: Engage with digital tools used for communication/writing.

7C6BC9BEF17D4FCAAD75BF49EFD37ED3.description: Identify digital tools that can be used for writing.

26B2640001E744E9A69E5CBE6B7C20AF.description: With guidance and support, explore and use digital tools used to communicate thoughts, feelings, ideas, etc.

0FBD3177E60F463EA6FF571812B2A0E8.description: Use digital tools to capture communicated ideas, thoughts and feelings.

7112E45C2FA0486ABA695820D54AFCB1.description: With guidance and support, use digital tools to produce and publish writing.

535265B1403042949B0164D3C5A3166A.description: Use digital tools that offer collaboration features.

A5E67F6179414E8294F474CFA3B7E143.description:
With guidance and
support from adults, use
a variety of digital tools to
produce and publish writing,
including in collaboration with
peers.

68DF6D001DAC48A49ED5869101F65FBB.description: Select a topic for writing or conversation.

A26B51ABB3E6471BBEF19E60B5222DF6.description: Write or communicate on topic without straying.

6243DEAE955C443FA100512D053A8CE0.description: Elaborate on a communicated message following a question.

2C1A6EBAD7714CD795995C72B7BAF541.description: Communicate multiple points on one topic.

040E01ACCE5849139E48553909D6D9F1.description: Transfer communicated topic and details into print. (e.g. record voice using speech to text

55505BC5CA6442318E546CF1C2F9CD82.description: Share writing with others for feedback.

91ADDBABCB0343D3A9A4E3419369B5BE.description: Listen to questions and feedback about writing.

EE96EFFCD43041BB9D500C194F351669.description: Elaborate on a written topic by adding multiple details.

42466E897149428A993847D8CF053747.description: Describe what others suggest to strengthen writing.

86F781F1381646729ED355BF119BAA22.description:
With guidance and
support from adults, focus on
a topic, respond to questions
and suggestions from peers,
and add details to strengthen
writing as needed.

7B46D4164A1C4C27B3E119A97428396B.description: Engage during sequenced events in daily activity.

E34F547AADC84726B8DC3F71359BCDCA.description: Actively participate in events with two or more sequential details.

B55EF80DF895433F9DC014FE30128054.description: Tell about two or more details from a selected event.

DF5DC94A1B6E4AB684E784E1D59162BB.description: Order details in writing to convey a sequence of events.

47F4BA476AE7450B8EEBF6DA194325E1.description: Integrate temporal words into writing to convey sequence of events.

A117A10881D6472AB81ECE1409B62BEA.description:
Write narratives in
which they recount two
or more appropriately
sequenced events, include
some details regarding what
happened, use temporal
words to signal event order,
and provide some sense of
closure.

03C84F0B1D8845EFA1E71BDDECE9388E.description: Engage with a person, activity or object to show interest in a topic.

417CDC507FD148F1956A33DE8E5A6E1A.description: Engage with objects that represent potential writing topics.

7DBBA72DE6E348BA8DBE4D587CC0956D.description: Choose an object that represents a writing topic.

8376D7AA5E054BD8BBF1110FA1DE95BF.description: Identify/communicate at least one fact about a topic.

C586FC9804C24D8C8AA79AF6313EF26D.description: Generate written text about a topic, and provide one fact about the topic.

DA75E252AA0E4874A166CAEB90794E75.description: Generate text that explains a topic in detail.

06F889E2BF7043F9ABB2AB374EA3BCB3.description:
Write informative/
explanatory texts in which
they name a topic, supply
some facts about the topic,
and provide some sense of
closure.

6063E0E23EBC4CA3B8B8E475462D0AB9.description: Engage in activities where opinions are shared

B07842B9212F4F40AB87315789B81B4B.description: Actively participate in communication/writing opportunities (using individualized modes and methods).

E9EE5082CE1D4DBAA88AE3EA66BADC17.description: Communicate a personal thought about a topic or book

B765BA5233A049D8A4312C1EA47AE12B.description: Identify an opinion as one’s own thoughts or feelings about something

75544F4295C54D6FAD1C01CD40A5AF9A.description:
Generate written text (from direct selection using words, photographs, icons, objects, augmentative communication system,
sign language, etc.) stating a basic opinion on a topic.

0C16989E5437413693E5CB42CD2E543B.description:
Write opinion pieces
in which they introduce the
topic or name the book they
are writing about, state an
opinion, supply a reason for
the opinion, and provide some
sense of closure.

EA233D5A425F4EBB9C99E81792EE6E8A.description: Note: see RL.1.10 and RI.1.10 and all RF standards for additional skills in this sequence.

010940C50C68434E9303F8AB99F25A8D.description: Engage with letters representing first sounds in words

9FC7F08DA0C54D5A9883D32B1ED29071.description: Actively engage with letters, sounds, and words.

87162AB0544D4AE8991F3C46F35C03BD.description: Actively participate in supported grade-level/age-appropriate, adapted texts.

7B685F8C69E44B0A8150B5524B9E5B7C.description: Demonstrate foundational knowledge in phonological/phonemic awareness

39F892DB2C764BB185FACA79855D79BE.description:
Articulate all letter sounds accurately with increasing automaticity until fluent (each sound symbol correspondence within 1
second)

7595CC47EDE9469EA492BECB612100B1.description: Demonstrate letter-sound knowledge with increasing automaticity

1FCF6F5DE6254CBBADD93C38FFDE56DD.description: Represent sound for each letter in alphabet with automaticity

4EF5013C029B45EC8B0CF616D157B0EB.description: Stretch spoken words by individual sounds then state or select the whole word.

CC5596CA75F74711AAA0B0D1E18247A1.description:
Decode words by saying all sounds in the word represented by letter symbols with increasing automaticity until fluent (within 1
second)

E6163499EE57431D9DE938DE7908BF49.description: Decode predictable short vowels with automaticity and fluency

CC51F0341F5849DCA1794E1C277D9681.description: Decode CVC words with automaticity and fluency

1DEDFAF4282B44E48797AC7C39492CFD.description: Use decoding skills to self-correct, rereading word as necessary.

4F01D4AD6F514A8D87298D805917EDE8.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition, rereading as necessary.

C5D73A2C2B5E4EECA1232305053C6E5A.description: A word has as many syllables as it has vowel sounds.

3C401AD8053B4C6FB88604CBD9350067.description: Orally break up a given word into syllables

1A7AE15097BC4CF198D1A1169009676D.description: Identify syllables within a printed word

466676BDC9F7433387C97B1B55BE775B.description: Break words into syllables to support decoding multi-syllable words.

CD3D4901D56643BE82760C4314E91D2F.description: Demonstrate the spelling-sound correspondences during decoding

F216D71566FE417CB0C4199523BCF92D.description: Read grade-level text orally with increased accuracy and fluency on successive readings.

D97A0316757240149F055D0C8B35C255.description: Read grade-level text with fluency to support understanding.

6A530C8DEE694C958099837847BC2746.description:
Read with sufficient
accuracy and fluency to
support comprehension.
a. Read grade-level text with
purpose and understanding.
b. Read grade-level text orally
with accuracy, appropriate
rate, and expression on
successive readings.
c. Use context to confirm or
self-correct word recognition
and understanding,
rereading as necessary.

7E3E2D26D1744BDB8D245BB0C0BFFF40.description: Engage with letters representing first sounds in words

852649DFC5FA4F96A453FCA843A86A12.description: A word has as many syllables as it has vowel sounds.

9F02D3D0C4A54A7AA170F16D3279D4BB.description: Breaking words into syllables supports decoding multi-syllable words.

05F679E912F9496BB47CE029287431CD.description: Irregularly spelled words refers to words that are not spelled as they sound (e.g., above, country, again).

AB5C0F7691774446BFDC99A51BFF0C56.description: Know the six types of written syllable patterns.

8997E182FD4F400191293DD587134A0C.description: There are six types of written syllable patterns.

7882346C776243B8A33E3FB4C93A44E5.description: Every syllable must have a vowel sound.

7403A737A4A9406EA88D0E3546B817B0.description: Specific common vowel teams represent long vowel sounds (e.g., ai, oa, ee).

0841CE24540F4C8694176984C0C373B5.description: Determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

C2D7D4F2BA19495FB5D2E31F262F2674.description: Stretch spoken words by individual sounds then state or select the whole word.

14F1D1B7E9EB4F63B7F5AA51348EAF38.description: Distinguish between similarly spoken words by identifying the letters where the sound differs

3A7C28B09CB94F518B9079D7662FCF9F.description: Produce (orally or augmented) the primary or most frequent sound for each consonant and vowel.

A87A3E09C62F486BBA0530DB3D8C83C8.description:
Know and apply
grade-level phonics and word
analysis skills in decoding
words.
a. Know the spelling-sound
correspondences for
common consonant
digraphs.
b. Decode regularly spelled
one-syllable words.
c. Know final e and common
vowel team conventions
for representing long vowel
sounds.
d. Use knowledge that every
syllable must have a vowel
sound to determine the
number of syllables in a
printed word.
e. Decode two syllable words
following basic patterns
by breaking the words into
syllables.
f. Read words with inflectional
endings.
g. Recognize and read
grade-appropriate
irregularly spelled words.

9DFFBBD29A2948F99D4AACF5D9C70CF7.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

FFC564FCAFC440F1B9BC6D4F473ECEE4.description: Isolate and pronounce the final sound in CVC words.

EA3005700BC34CAB959F6E58DCBD73C4.description: Isolate and pronounce the medial vowel sound in CVC words

59D2C2DA57A445FDBE0E04DBCD6A93B5.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial sound in CVC words

2596D7335A1A47C18AC21ED1302B51ED.description: Segment onsets and rimes in single-syllable spoken words.

C1A20B2B16964A50BD77E971B85DB7E0.description: Blend onsets and rimes in single-syllable spoken words.

A7BB2F174D584FA1B5C6F8D602E8D232.description: Note: In the hierarchy of phonological awareness spoken whole words and word parts comes before onset and rime.

33A5F7C267D5407E9BADD5C2F5AF434E.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables and sounds (e.g., tap/clap syllables of a word).

B790F385A9D74E32AA57BA332E8111F0.description: Identify the beginning sound of the name of an object.

1386D40EBA3B4931BE23B3A0AE866889.description: Identify the ending sound of a word.

A5228F4F31474BC49E7AACFF89D6C0D5.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of spoken
words, syllables, and
phonemes (sounds).
a. Distinguish ling from short
vowel sounds in spoken
single syllable words.
b. Orally produce singlesyllable words by blending
phonemes, including
consonant blends.
c. Isolate and pronounce initial
medial vowel, and final
phonemes in spoken singlesyllable words.
d. Segment spoken singlesyllable words.

4B6838A010DA48CE9B11C5B904FD1FD5.description: Knowing the letter names can support recalling the sound of the letter (e.g., b, d, z).

241D5D0A65E542B28FD6212091514338.description: In print, spaces separate words to help the reader know where a word begins and ends.

79F9A3EF6D144535BAE16628B071CB86.description: Letters are written symbols that represent the sounds of language.

A8DE544042264BA5B3D3621A1CEBDF68.description: Print is organized in a specific format to convey meaning.

6816CD568C184E768661FCBB867D80B3.description: Name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

938BE4D45ED740FCB84CD1D784A244B2.description: Identify all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

99BF793BA37842AE8342C48FC97E74BF.description: Show that words are separated by spaces in print.

9A2615912247450B89443250C3701555.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

E715644BB80F42F7A20FE188F79BBD05.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

4412FC9EECA64EF1A98AA62B6997299E.description: Most letter names are closely related to their corresponding sound.

D8856E2BFEDC4F919EC4BA722EAF5AE4.description: Lowercase letters refers to the smaller form of the letters in the alphabet.

2C3A036BF4B44133B9F2575827BAD802.description: Uppercase letters refers to the capital letters in the alphabet.

685FF1D0D9DE41DFBC7F6B488207487F.description: Alphabet refers to a system of letters in a fixed order that represents the sounds of the language.

17994FC457274303AD1D607AB37DBF9C.description: Identify that words refers to specific combinations of written letters that represent a spoken word.

C87174B2CCF84E53BF0F729F9CC9E833.description: Track words from left to right, top to bottom, and note correct page orientation.

54A1F012C8254E4A8064B5B67231E04A.description: Identify organizational features of a sentence (e.g., words, capitalization ending punctuation).

F49FF616CC92480484DDA91819AB54C8.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of the
organization and basic
features of print by
recognizing the distinguishing
features of a sentence (e.g.,
first word, capitalization,
ending punctuation)

F8823CF817B14A2283F2956AF1AE2959.description:
Actively engage in reading activities using orally presented
and text-based, 1st grade-level, informational texts, using
scaffolding and adaptations as needed.

CAD79D0B95C744F59E41CE602DC94C4A.description:
Actively participate in reading activities using orally
presented and text-based, 1st grade-level, age-appropriate,
informational texts, using scaffolding and adaptations as
needed.

D1D9E2B88E9542A38441C5CDA5227DCD.description: Break orally presented word into syllables

3BD4EC60158445DC973ACAED626040FD.description:
Break an orally presented word into onset/first sound and
rime

BC12517BCE304B69A9C3543E60F1722E.description: Break orally presented word into phonemes

A41C71B1310A406C8415F773DB995BCA.description:
Match 26 letters to most common sounds (Predictable
consonants: m, s, t, l, p, f, c, /k/, rr, b, r, j, k, v, g, /g/, w, d, h,
y, z, x)

6AF9009119BA4022A61E053503A0CFEE.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 2
letter sound combinations in 2 letter words

7017F4A36ACD4B0790D7CF2445DF5CB4.description:
Identify words with common phonemic VC word patterns
(word families)

F48C010E66274D18A3BC434CD911136D.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 3
letter sound combinations/3 letter words (CVC words)

9751D2B8BD52482FB4FA379527132820.description:
With prompting and support decode and read CVC words
within a grade level text.

B63BD8FE462B42A5A5F5F4E6C0D52500.description:
Combine 2 consonants that make one sound. (i.e., sh, ch,
wh, th, ng)

B0B14CCF6BAC421AABCE8E3380C19B56.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by combining 2
consonant sounds into consonant blends (qu, st, sm, sn, st,
lp, sr, sl,cr, cl, tr, dr, etc.)

B69B9CF5A4CE43619D9933072566F8D9.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by combining 3
consonant sounds into consonant blends (squ, str, scr, thr,
shr)

3A3DF9E13BB24622986123B5DB4ADD93.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 3-4
letter sound combinations/4 letter words (CCVC words) (V
also includes ee, ea, ai, ay, oa)

C1D211EB74154DFB8B28398383A4C42B.description:
With prompting and support decode and read CCVC words
within a grade-level decodable text.

51C3BF15ED124BE88122D2ACF1EDC007.description:
By the end of year, read decodable, informational texts,
using the skills outlined below.

06BDCCCC476C4F8B8F9089788AF3CA91.description:
With prompting and
support, read informational
texts appropriately complex
for grade 1.

A62A5052A11443F9A0C9345B07635C7D.description:
Range of Reading and Level
of Text Complexity

A6177A08D95242BFBDCBA7CDEA874878.description: Actively engage during the sharing of two informational texts on the same topic.

A42821CCFC244EC4BDA1014D77529A56.description: Identify similarities as being the same or alike, but not identical.

E73203E410894D768FEC8727311CA93E.description: Procedures refers to a series of steps that build on one another and lead to an outcome.

7E0CB5B7057241469D5A7709F62FBE94.description: Descriptions refers to an account that includes all the relevant features or characteristics.

91F0B6787D1A4DF888D4423763A43585.description: Illustrations refers to the pictures, drawings, or visual aids that provide a visual representation of some part of the text.

DAAC16D95E8C4DE1A801796708C3553A.description: Topic refers to a subject or focus of a text.

F06ED48B076A4AFABABF600CC228ED5E.description: Identify two texts that have similar topics.

C2FF93B5314B422281413A112394799A.description: Identify the similarities in two texts that address the same topic.

11A0052BF4E64B52A71D58114919EA9C.description: Describe similarities and differences between two versions of a text on the same topic.

D300413C57A440D5934C318B59E6027A.description:
Identify basic
similarities in and differences
between two texts on
the same topic (e.g., in
illustrations, descriptions, or
procedures).

5A948443ED114F70B19947AF8541338A.description: Actively engage in shared informational text that contains a topic of interest.

3643D1F17B0945578696C4A0E412CFC0.description: identify that facts are proven points of information

A0332E3D6AFC4CCFAFB28A3D20BE8676.description: identify the difference between fact and fiction

4C3AB5C7F93744C4BE8CB3345CBB1043.description: Match one of the author’s topics to one or more supporting detail from the text.

00544AE5AAF641119E9C0F6960B7D7DE.description: Identify one or more topics the author writes about in a text.

DDA8B6CA2C394AB8B89146BFFAF9FC45.description: Indicate the author who wrote a given text.

D2C513D0565341C1A57151A9DB27754E.description: Indicate the author’s name or picture on/in a given text.

4953F9EB9DB4435D851328FAE4F9DC2D.description: Points refers to ideas, opinions, or claims.

3E0BD9FB68164A059A0EAE34D1CAB697.description: Author refers to a person who presents ideas or information in written form.

ED4945FA2C1C4FE7BE1C97177C143412.description: Reasons refers to causes or explanations.

018A7B8B4DFC4D43A44596828CB72CF0.description: Identify refers to recognizing and/or naming.

01BA7F60A6CE4BF799C1B2B7CD62B466.description: Identify that authors of informational texts write using facts.

EAE33A9F5DFA474A86DCBEA36802BFDF.description: Identify that authors of informational texts use proven facts to support their own words.

77BF269B5E4B4352B3DC1053816B715B.description: Identify one or more reasons/facts an author gives to support their own words in written text.

3B93D7F35F3340C995F89225F0292A0C.description:
Identify the reasons an
author gives to support points
in a text.

256956C7B8D948E78C4D49CEF58F2044.description: Actively engage in shared informational text that contains illustrations.

165DEBD3B20C4144BE4DD79ED19E96F2.description: Point out matching keywords in both text and illustrations.

5B0635E9F10A4757A6A2BFFAA2B6DA6D.description: Listen for, and indicate when, information that matches a given illustration from a text.

9D8D7A3D4E4D445EAE42A36AE4EEC517.description: indicate when text matches visual supports in text

AC68D91CA15749B0985A0C46DE77756F.description: Distinguish between print and illustrations in informational text.

54B32ACB02BA41F0843CA13E5EB85130.description: Identify ideas found in illustrations and those found in text.

9BBCF224814A4C218BAEFC280D14E5BE.description: Use illustrations and details from a text to describe key ideas.

A299CD15CF2A4F74AF3FA6A08E7954BF.description:
Use the illustrations
and details in a text to
describe its key ideas.

F6388742E2D24EA5AFD9C371520F5B8E.description: Actively engage with illustrations or content in shared informational text.

8D8875EF416B4FE98D68FCA8C3BF73D9.description: Define the illustrator’s role in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

8E8284D520A1401A8A4DD8B405E23AE2.description: Name the illustrator of a text.

E6E5E3BFD9F74EAE98B2B69915834040.description: Define the author’s role in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

ABDD43B137F349C7B4843D16C8D7CEFE.description: Identify the author of a text.

B33F8BE0BAD642359F9187936E2F072B.description: Identify a picture that provides information in a text.

C856BFFFCCEA4C70B3BB79648754F575.description: Identify pictures or words in an informational text that provide an idea or information.

058A3C5FA0F8400EAE291800AC02F593.description:
Compare pictures or other illustrations to see if they provide the same or different information than the information provided by
the words in a text.

891F672FA533483A90BDD6C08915B552.description:
Distinguish between
information provided by
pictures or other illustrations
and information provided by
the words in a text.

70B5C5EF66CF487ABABC89179DBDD75F.description: Actively engage in the handling of a book.

9E6C63B24E4A4E1681E51B9047EDE3EA.description: identify large or bold text as important text features (possibly headings, key terms, titles, etc.)

21775F461C9F45D98E1FD1D61AB4DC9F.description: identify page numbers in a text

E6C02B8940744B50930EDBADEC37B2D8.description: indicate the author of a book

0AD24EA68177466E84C3BF63F05D8351.description: indicate the title of the book

362AF4950BD340EC98D1B5CC780FCB3D.description: identify the pictures in a book

596BE3D3D3EB4834986F1D821CF740FE.description: identify the pictures in a book

08F85EC5CD25459F8D95FAB142531C95.description: indicate the pages in a book

FEC07AAA70104C12A4AFE828BA60E174.description: indicate the cover of the book

39334822C1E642E4B7B3A3D6716ACF94.description: turn pages in a book moving from front to back

52B59D24133E476D865A38AAE1DB5AAD.description: Match the table of contents with the front of the book.

1944728515744B4681A5DB889BA175EF.description: Match the glossary with the back of the book.

171E838C9B064A4C862ACD3F6221E086.description: Identify text features (e.g., headings, table of contents, glossaries) used in informational text.

694725F89B2F4749B303382ACDD1E2CE.description:
Know and use various
text features (e.g., headings,
tables of contents, glossaries,
electronic menus, icons) to
locate key facts or information
in a text.

5463DBA6D0874C928055A16925376620.description:
Actively engage with objects, tactile graphics or other sensory experiences related to better understand the meaning of words
in a text.

5200FADCF1F14F84AA56187D32F1432D.description: Actively engage during Q & A about informational text vocabulary.

0F54E1E165E64ADC8B34A81A76732907.description:
use word study strategies from all brain processors (phonology, orthography, phonics, semantics and syntax) to develop
word meaning in auditorily presented text (break word into onset and rime, break word into syllables, sight words, root words,
morphemes, break word into phonemes, simple parts of speech, etc.)

ED8A0EC90FBE4631A57871A010E62AC7.description: give associations to everyday life that help develop meaning in unknown words or phrases

3BC71CEA1AEB4842BC5DFA95CD5234FD.description: Identify a word and/or a phrase (vs. a letter or a number, or a sentence or paragraph).

6ECEA988E81041B093E803E63E7622AA.description: Describe that words have meaning beyond just naming the word by sight.

9D927E7B54EF46479EFA6AD11E01C178.description: Identify words whose meaning is familiar and those whose meaning is unfamiliar.

7124A3BE6FFB41D5899BD985CF9E2E50.description:
Ask and answer
questions to help determine or
clarify the meaning of words
and phrases in a text.

BA804269414F44D684E679863B844868.description: Actively engage in activities where text information is shared and connected.

5CC73FCC94BB49008DC96AF3B07DE904.description:
When you describe a connection, you tell or explain how two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text share
something in common.

3F3E799EBA9E4997AEEC2782FE2FA6A8.description: Connections can be made when two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text have something in common.

38A6088E9686455FA323D15B440A24D9.description: Note: Connection refers to a relationship or having something in common.

238299F37B46401E8422A3BF59DE8881.description: Note: Describe refers to giving an account that includes all the relevant information.

FD9BA349C23E47A8958979F5A4B7EDBC.description: identify the similarities and differences between two shared informational texts

5607F00DD432476C82E4F55C0F75C67D.description: compare two shared informational text with prompting and support

CEA8314DC4BD4D299FF90CC94D9C04F8.description: select, identify or describe a detail from a shared informational text

B3BB1111F1E44EDFA8E3AAFF9AA8E0E5.description: identify information, events and ideas as details from within informational text

1E85D7CAB68641A0A753772DE34C0BA4.description: identify individuals as people within informational text

2065829FC6C1457D8BF7AA34AB611503.description: Identify two events, ideas, or individuals from a text.

2088B77B83BA469D8D56949E5CFD7542.description: Describe two one or more events, ideas, or individuals from a text.

DD5715F742044E5781655C5C496FAB4D.description: Describe the connections between events, ideas, information, or individuals in a text.

40C6DDE049224ACDB53CFF2C34DD2C56.description:
Describe the
connection between two
individuals, events, ideas, or
pieces of information in a text.

27344F1FF9FE4370B780C13A06420285.description: Engage with informational text on a topic of choice

61569CCE92674F60BA31C738EAEA066B.description: Select informational text containing the topic of choice

22526134662C4A2AB862A17961C754A9.description: Identify the topic of a given text

40E547F429A34F1F9B9AF2535FC6A789.description: Engage while text is read aloud or read text

0168ADDDE4204F29A95FBB6FD6127F53.description: As text is read, identify details that describe main topic

E30DDB8100FF4DA8A34DBAE63E20AD6D.description: Record details as text is read

2D13563D50F44DE0A02118D8AA9FBDA4.description: Analyze the process for developing informational text (i.e. identify topic, add key details, etc.)

DCE3955FCB3E4214B19A604FC0172A8B.description:
Analyze informational
text development.
a. Identify the main topic.
b. Retell key details of a text.

C1DEDD00EEE54DB5B239C9F4A0BCD4BD.description: Actively engage with someone who is asking a question.

1ACA73B600794FEA90F7B4AD5EB8848F.description: Actively engage with shared informational text.

0563CD154F8949DF870F8BFAFC58767C.description: Take note of details as the text is shared - note with objects, pictures, words, symbols, etc.

3575AB5CAE674B72A41496B5049FB88D.description: Associate what questions with topic and details

C3BE232E912D440C85997A2AC9F35E98.description: Associate where questions with geographic location

32D1BC9514954EBC8DDD8BB4426EA081.description: Ask a question to gain understanding of informational text.

B0835783CFB440B798BBB83E5A573151.description: Link given question to key details provided within informational text.

A08A6047F68C4B269A2AC1FAF4B48928.description: Answer question to demonstrate understanding of one or more concrete details from informational text.

D6A28316459842B989C67F3CCA619592.description:
Ask and answer
questions about key details in
a text.

DA27ED56039A46BB9886979273D4B6CF.description: Actively engage in group reading activities.

3A8ED39E42784AE6B9204AA1C38FA3DF.description: Actively engage in grade-level/age-appropriate literature materials.

323C6F046BE1447B9B77E4EC4A15EB00.description:
Actively participate in grade-level/age-appropriate literature
activities using adapted materials as needed.

017973242D744726881E8DA2F69D9072.description:
Actively engage in group reading activities that activate prior
knowledge related to previous life experiences.

4F08EFD14A424516B27738079E9736DB.description: Select texts related to prior experiences.

86F7C568BB464AA8ABC5ECDD66F0A609.description:
Actively engage in group reading activities that activate text-to-self
connections.

F92BDB5E2DF243F99F6C60EC53F1AF3A.description: break an orally given word into syllables

Match 26 letters to most common sounds (Predictable consonants:

CA1A7F78519A4DB291DC261354CC3DBD.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 2 letter

Identify words with common phonemic VC word patterns (word

Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 3 letter

With prompting and support decode and read CVC words within a

Combine 2 consonants that make one sound. (i.e., sh, ch, wh, th,
ng)

7B2E2C01EB30454694E5811E35E68BC6.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by combining 2

sl,cr, cl, tr, dr, etc.)

9F90BA65BD224169899826C6ED6DF5F1.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by combining 3
consonant sounds into consonant blends (squ, str, scr, thr, shr)

4BA0FDFA1A8C46EE9BB8C4792ACC66E3.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of 26 letter sounds by building 3-4 letter

With prompting and support decode and read CCVC words within a

B626B8CB2CA84E0FA250FCEC226B39BA.description:
Actively engage in group reading activities that activate text-to-text
comparisons, and connections.

2DBB8DF085374EB69E94923A5F8213C1.description:
While participating in group reading activity identify and
communicate details from the text (characters, setting, topic) to be
recorded.

4F2CE4A520EF43968273F112341FB9E1.description:
With support, compare details from two texts using visual/tactile

81ED8073BAC34C798340B981430BE2D5.description:
Select two texts with a similar topic, character or setting to
demonstrate text-to-text comparison/connection.

659FE4139C1146D480A0129938629BAE.description:
With prompting
and support, read prose
and poetry of appropriate
complexity for grade.
Activate prior knowledge and
draw on previous experiences
in order to make text-to-self or
text-to-text connections and
comparisons.

0E2C167135DB4148820F3CB8C94EB341.description:
Range of Reading and Level
of Text Complexity

613844AA97F04BBA927C529F34A22655.description: use a graphic organizer to map details from a story

7A3D25AEEB70416F9B742232DB9C4C03.description: identify characters as people or animals in a text

835CDDFE685B4384B43BA305BF60920E.description: Map three or more events (e.g. beginning, middle, end - per story) using pictures, objects or words for two versions of a story.

D883600410114212AE9C7BDD63D015E9.description: Identify similarities or differences between events in two versions of a story.

169032C5A62F49E89BE3705A02768CA0.description:
Compare and
contrast the adventures and
experiences of characters in
stories.

B2326A6574CA4959B633B1546DEBAD41.description: indicate details of interest from a story

E163E623A7074719BC07FF3DF56307EE.description: match images/objects to text as it is read as a reminder of people, places or events

324E81039A00457493F3E2679B67CF50.description: identify setting as the place(s)/locations in a text

75D043407A294AB398D4AB0135519425.description: identify characters as people or animals in a text

7D7A4E89CE0B43E7A2BE3E7FF8093DD4.description: identify illustrations as pictures from a story

283E6F036029466EAA737D616E328E3D.description: Indicate elements of character(s) or setting in a picture from a text.

Use illustrations and
details in a story to describe
its characters, setting, or
events.

A023EF42B2904B919EA8DA970AF2EE25.description: Match a character to what they say in the story.

287A654EDC894830A0118801F3CA93B7.description:
Identify who is telling
the story at various points in
a text.

36DB291350344A0B99549297313817B4.description: Actively engage during the sharing of both fiction and non-fiction.

1F5AC15E671445CC9F2F770844C92F45.description: locate text features in books (table of contents, photographs, tables or charts, glossary, story beginning, story ending, etc.)

D948540C0B1B43CB9C29AF247ABFEE7D.description: explore a wide range of text types

6638220CF7084D958F9468C192257E97.description: Select a book that provides real life information.

D84F3B59903F42CD8D76BC78C1BCEF7D.description: Identify at least one characteristic of informational texts (non-fiction) and one characteristic of literary texts (fiction).

1060617BC78342679A43E7AC9999E283.description:
Explain major
differences between books
that tell stories and books that
give information, drawing on a
wide range of text types.

Identify words and
phrases in stories or poems
that suggest feelings or
appeal to the senses.

4560AA479A024A6AA69D510C60206DC8.description: Actively engage during the sharing of any story.

2850A667777243BC8D89ED501D8D1E49.description: events contain characters - who, settings and details

Describe characters,

3AA8585E8620457683CB39C1EDADB4EF.description: explore common threads between lessons and rules

questions about key details in
